preqs: For students who commenced their LLB (Hons) course in 2015 or later:LAW1111; LAW1114; LAW1112; LAW1113; LAW2101; LAW2102; LAW2112; LAW2111For students who commenced their LLB course prior to 2015:LAW1100 or LAW1101 and LAW1102 or LAW1104

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {LAW1102, LAW1104} or  Must have passed 6 (I/W) units in {LAW1112, LAW1113, LAW1114, LAW2102, LAW2111, LAW2112})
(Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {LAW1102, LAW1104} or  Must have passed 6 (I/W) units in {LAW1112, LAW1113, LAW1114, LAW2102, LAW2111, LAW2112})
For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {L3%} Do Any 4 (I/W) co-req units in {LAW2101, LAW2102, LAW2201, LAW2202} Otherwise For COURSE_CODE IN {L3%} Do Any 2 (I/W) co-req units in {LAW3111, LAW4332} Otherwise true
Must be enrolled in course owned by {50000567, 50000568}
Must be enrolled in course owned by {50000567, 50000568}
For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {L3%} Do Any 4 (I/W) co-req units in {LAW2101, LAW2102, LAW2201, LAW2202} Otherwise For COURSE_CODE IN {L3%} Do Any 2 (I/W) co-req units in {LAW3111, LAW4332} Otherwise true

description: The focus of the unit is the major steps in litigation. Using the Rules of the Supreme Court of Victoria, the chronology of a civil proceeding from the decision to sue until the matter is ready for trial is examined.
